result.execSummary:
The defendant Brennan Dakarai Strauch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment in conjunction with his AODA treatment; at the agent's discretion.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no contact with Hobby Lobby, Menards, Fleet Farm, Walgreens and Walmart.
Continue with AODA counseling/treatment currently engaged in.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brennan Dakarai Strauch

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on March 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty pleas.   Jury Calendar.    Offer deadline with DA is set for 03-04-22 at 8:30 a.m.   Scheduling conference is set for 04-20-22 at 11:00 a.m.   Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant is to have no contact with Menards.   
Minutes.
